page.title: 13Buildings-The 'Stute'
page.content: Nine Mile Point Miners' Institute, built in 1913,is the largest building in Cwmfelinfach.For many years it was the place where miners and their families went for relaxation,entertain -ment,and education.The locally quarried sandstone building is very imposing.I remember playing snooker, pool,watching pantomimes and concerts, and playing on 'Space Invaders' there. But it became too expensive to run so downstairs its many rooms were rented to Sports Fix for manufacturing and storage.Upstairs is the concert hall, the seats torn and soaking from leaks. Above the balcony is a dingy projection room,the equipment is there but lies obsolete.In the basement Pinkhouse Electronics occupy the swimming pool-now all cracked and boarded over.With so little in the village the 'Stute' needs restoring.
